posts.post_content:
1907 F.P. Burke Postcard -- Chicago Cubs

Very rare Cubs postcard, $320.  Not sure why it's graded A, but the card is in good shape with very little wrinkling.  

[url=https://flic.kr/p/f1rsUW][img]https://farm4.staticflickr.com/3807/9193963086_e110aa2b3e_o.jpg[/img][/url]


1906 Ullman Mike Donlin Postcard

Just 1 of 4 graded by SGC and PSA combined, this is the second highest graded. $1500.

[url=https://flic.kr/p/grZ2r8][img]https://farm4.staticflickr.com/3754/10139390125_f028fd795f_o.jpg[/img][/url]



PM or email if interested, thanks.

[quote name="Jacker_ Cracks" post=1387418]:eek::eek::eek: Absolute Beauties Jeff![/QUOTE]


+1 Best eye candy this section has seen in a while.

Never like to see cards sell without 3-4 bumps for price reductions and the seller being forced to let them go for what he "has in them."

Nice postcards, by the way. Except for the Lajoie. I heard the other graded one technically is nicer.

[quote name="Rob D." post=1387488]Never like to see cards sell without 3-4 bumps for price reductions and the seller being forced to let them go for what he "has in them."

Nice postcards, by the way. Except for the Lajoie. I heard the other graded one technically is nicer.[/QUOTE]

I'll sell my entire collection right now for what I have in the cards LOL.

As for that other Lajoie, I heard it was trimmed and postally used.  Shame.
